717484f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street
717484f-a.text:
Buroadway, east side, north from 42nd Street. In the foregrour
are the Longacre and Fitzgerald Buildings, and the entrance to the
George M. Cohan Theatre. In the next block are the Hotels Cadills
and Claridge, and above them the Criterion and New York theatres.
At the extreme left is the Hotel Astor.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
., ~260E

717485f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street (West)
717485f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from but not including West 42nd
Street.
September 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713058f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (West) - Broadway
713058f-a.text:
W. 42nd Street, north side, from Broadway (right) to Seventh
Avenue (loft) showing the triangular site of the present Times
Building. The ornate building shown is insoribed ''Charles Thorley,
A. D. 1896.'' At the loft ie Oscar Hammerstoins ''Victoria''.
May 11, 1900
Gift of Urbrock ollection
H. N. Tiomann, photo
CREDIT LINE IMTEERATIVE

717481f-a.text:

1490-1486 ind 1480-76 Broadway, east side, south from West 43rd (left)

713061f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Broadway
713061f-a.text:
42nd Street, noth side, west from Broadway, showing the Times
Building in the foreground.
1926.
Brown Brothers.

717479f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street
717479f-a.text: Recoieved from Cross S Brown Eo., Harch 1968.

717476f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street
717476f-a.text:
Broadway at the.S.E. corner of 42nd Street. What would have
been a good northward view of Broadway is blocked by the subway kiosk.
About 1921.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723544f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street (West)
723544f-a.text:
Times Square, north from West 42nd Street (foreground) and showing
mainly structures lining the east side of this intersecting point of
Broadway and Seventh Ave. This is a set of 3 views, No. 2 of which is
from West 43rd Street. No. 3 shows the new building on the east side of
same, between 44th and 45th Streets that houses the Criterion Theatre and
the International Casino. Atop same is the huge electric dieplay sign
of Wrigleys. For earlier views of this area, see the Broadway files.
September 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723544f-c.text:

717473f-a.text:

ing the Brokaw Brothers Building on right.

713051f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (West) - Broadway
713051f-a.text:
West 42nd Street, south side, west from (No. 138; the Cameo Theatre)
a point slightly east of Broadway and across same. The 15-story structure
on the left is the former Knickerbocker Hotel that has been converted to
business purposes. It bears Nos. 1462-1470 Br-oadway and stands at the
S.E. corner of West 42nd Street. West of same appears a low structure
occupying the apex of a triangular plot between Broadway and Seventh Ave.
Progressing in the same direction one sees the 24-story Candler Building
and the modern Graybar Building; the latter being between Eighth and
Ninth Aves. This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

723532f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street
723532f-a.text:
The New York Times Building, Broadway, west side, from 42nd to
43rd Streets. At the right is the Paramount Building and Theatre.
About 1927.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717475f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street
717475f.text:
Broadway, west side, from 42nd to 45th Streets. At the left,
construction work on the New York Times Building is under wav. At
43rd Street is the Hotel Cadillac, and above it is Rector'awhich,
along with the corner building at 44th Street, will soon be re-
placed by the Hotel Claridge. From 44th to 45th Streets are the
Criterion and Nem York theatres. The building which they occu,y,
which at the time of this picture is called the Crystal Gardens,
will be demolished in 1935. Broadway is badly torn up from subway
construction, which is nearly completed.
1903.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713051f-b.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (West) - Broadway

West 42nd Street, south side, west from (No. 138; the Cameo Theatre)

Progressing in the same direction one sees the 24-story Candler Building

September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

732258f-a.title: Newspapers - The New York Times - Buildings.
732258f-a.text:
''The New York Times'', moved uptown to 42nd Street, in 1905, at the south-
ern junction of Broadway and Seventh Ave.,(comnonly known as Times Square).
It was housed in this building up to 1913, when an annex was required.
Gift of ''The New York Times''.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717496f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 42nd Street (West)
717496f-a.text:
Proadway, at W. 44th Street as viewed northwestward from
the Bush Terminal Puilding on 42nd Street. This location apnears
in the center of the view and shows at the S.W., the N.A. a nd the
S.E. corners respectively, the Paramount Building, the Hotel Astor
and the Hotel Claridge. In the foreground apoears W. 43rd Street
with the 12 story Cadillac Hotel to the east of Times Scuare.
Adjacent to same and orly 6 stories in heicht is the H0tel Yates.
March 18, 1929.
P.L. Sperr
NO RSPRODUCTIO.S.
Astor Botel in daytime. 1926
Astor Hotel at Hidnight

713060f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (West) - Broadway
713060f-a.text:
West 42nd street, north side, west from and including Broadvay, to
and including Seventh Ave. Prominent building shown is the Times
Building. A general view north is also shown.
About 1924.
Ewing Galloway.  aea ahG 29
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713059f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street (West) - Broadway
713059f-a.text:
West 42nd Street, north side, between Broadway (right) and Seventh
Ave. (left), showing a triangular excavation extending to 43rd Street,
that is today (1937) occupied by the Times Building. This clearance was
created by the demolition of 6, 4-story houses, which bore Nos. 1469 to
1485 Broadway and 603 to 619 Seventh Ave. This area is now known as
Times Square.
December 4, 1901.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
NEG ~ 5N

713054f-a.text:
42nd Street at the S.E. corner of Broadway.
About 1915.
